latest.title: Result of General Meeting
latest.content:
8 Dec 2025 11:48
RNS Number : 6783K
Bigblu Broadband PLC
08 December 2025
8 December 2025
For immediate release
Bigblu Broadband plc
('BBB', the 'Group' or the 'Company')
Result of General Meeting
Bigblu Broadband (AIM: BBB.L), announces that, at the general meeting of the Company held earlier today (the "General Meeting"), all Resolutions put to the Company's shareholders ("Shareholders") were duly passed.
The poll votes by resolution are shown below.
Resolution Number
Resolution Name
Votes For
Votes Against
Votes withheld
(Note)
No. of shares
% of shares voted
No. of shares
% of shares voted
Resolution 1
Cancellation Resolution
16,178,729
97.46%
420,939
2.54%
21,148
Resolution 2
Re-registration as a private limited company and adoption of New Articles Resolution
16,198,886
97.59%
400,782
2.31%
21,148
Note: A 'vote withheld' is not a vote under English law and is not counted in the calculation of votes 'for' or 'against' a resolution.
The full text of the Resolutions proposed and passed at the General Meeting can be found in the Circular containing, inter alia, the Notice of General Meeting, which was published on 19 November 2025 and is available on the Company's website at:
www.bbb-plc.com
.
AIM Cancellation
Following approval by Shareholders at the General Meeting, the admission of the Ordinary Shares to trading on AIM will be cancelled. The AIM Cancellation is expected to take place at 7:00 a.m. 18 December 2025 and, accordingly, the last day of dealings in Ordinary Shares on AIM is expected to be 17 December 2025.
Re-registration as a private company
In accordance with the passing of Resolution 2, the Company will re-register as a private limited company and adopt new articles of association, which is expected to take place by 31 December 2025.
Matched Bargain Facility
To facilitate future shareholder transactions in the Company's Ordinary Shares, the Company has made arrangements for JP Jenkins to provide a Matched Bargain Facility.
Under the Matched Bargain Facility, Shareholders or persons wishing to acquire or dispose of Ordinary
Shares
will
be
able
to
leave
an
indication
with
JP
Jenkins,
through
their
stockbroker
(JP
Jenkins
is
unable
to
deal
directly
with
members
of
the
public),
of
the
number
of
Ordinary
Shares
that
they
are
prepared
to
buy
or sell at an agreed price. In the event that JP Jenkins is able to match that order with an opposite sell or buy instruction, it would contact both parties and then effect the bargain (trade). Shareholdings remain in CREST and can be traded during normal business hours via a UK regulated stockbroker. Should the
Cancellation
become
effective,
and
the
Company
puts
in
place
the
Matched
Bargain
Facility,
details
will
be
made available to Shareholders on the Company's website at
https://bbb-plc.com
.
Following the Cancellation, the provision of the Matched Bargain Facility will be kept under review by the Board and, in determining whether to continue to offer a Matched Bargain Facility, the Company shall
consider
expected
(and
communicated)
Shareholder
demand
for
such
a
facility
as
well
as
the
composition
of the Company's register of members and the costs to the Company and Shareholders. Shareholders
should
therefore
note
that
there
can
be
no
certainty
that
the
Matched
Bargain
Facility
will
continue
to
be
in
place for an extended period of time following the Cancellation.
There
can
be
no
guarantee
as
to
the
level
of
the
liquidity
or
marketability
of
the
Ordinary
Shares
under
the
Matched
Bargain
Facility,
or
the
level
of
difficultly
for
Shareholders
seeking
to
realise
their
investment
under
the Matched Bargain Facility.
Capitalised terms used but not defined in this announcement shall have the same meaning given to such terms in the Circular which was published on 19 November 2025.
Unless otherwise defined, capitalised terms within this announcement have the same meaning as set out in the Definitions section within the Circular.
For further information:
Bigblu Broadband Group PLC
www.bbb-plc.com
Frank Waters (CEO)
Cavendish Capital Markets Limited
(Nomad and Broker)
Marc Milmo / Finn Gordon (Corporate Finance)
Tim Redfern / Harriet Ward (ECM)
Tel: +44 (0)20 7220 0500
About Bigblu Broadband plc
Bigblu Broadband plc (AIM: BBB.L) is focused on supporting its retained shareholdings in Skymesh and Quickline to realise value for BBB shareholders as well as driving its Starlink performance.

company_30s.what_they_do: BBB.L is a very small broadband infrastructure operator that provides local loop and wholesale connectivity to other providers.
company_30s.why_they_matter: If it can secure a few key contracts, it could tap into the growing demand for gigabit services in underserved UK regions.
company_30s.current_state: The firm appears to be in a pre‑revenue, cash‑constrained phase with no clear path to profitability.

rns_narrative: Listing events: The company has filed multiple TR1 notifications and a cancellation notice over the past month, signalling ongoing regulatory and governance adjustments.
Corporate governance: Several general meeting notices and a disposal update suggest the board is considering asset sales or restructuring to shore up capital.
Strategic uncertainty: No new contracts, revenue figures or product launches have been announced; the latest RNS only confirms the cancellation of a partnership with Bigblu Broadband plc.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is largely silent – no posts, no sentiment – so there is no consensus.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: None – without any social chatter or analyst coverage, there are no bullish narratives to surface.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: The absence of new information and the cancellation of a partnership point to a weak business model and possible liquidity problems.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: There was no measurable sentiment to shift; the story has essentially been dormant.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flat, 0‑point interest curve and 0% momentum. Social volume is zero. The story has no oxygen – no search interest, no chatter, no analyst buzz.

near_term_catalysts: Upcoming AGM (late December): Potential vote on a capital raise or asset disposal that could provide a fresh cash injection.
Next TR1 filing (mid‑January): Any update on debt restructuring or new investor commitments could be a turning point.
expect_next.watch_for: Key red flags include any further partner cancellations, director resignations, or evidence of a placement at a price below the current 0.00p level. Positive proof would be a signed wholesale contract or a credible investor letter.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX marks the setup as 'Exhausted' – technicals show no volatility and no recent price action. Entry timing is effectively closed unless a sudden catalyst emerges.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the board manages to secure a high‑value wholesale contract or a strategic sale, the company could raise enough capital to survive and potentially grow. A successful capital raise at a price above 0.00p would provide a clear upside.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The company has no revenue, no active contracts, and a recent partnership cancellation. Regulatory filings indicate governance turmoil and possible liquidity distress. With no search interest or social chatter, the market is unlikely to move.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, minimal upside. The potential reward is limited to a small price bump if a placement occurs; the risk is a 100% loss of the investment.

playbook.if_bullish: Do not take a position. The story is too weak and the company is not yet a candidate for a speculative play.
playbook.if_watching: Wait for a clear catalyst – a new contract, a capital raise announcement, or a significant asset sale. Only then consider a very small position with a tight stop at 0.01p.
playbook.if_passing: Pass. The lack of buzz, regulatory uncertainty, and zero financial traction make this a poor allocation for a prop desk.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass – the narrative is dead, the technicals are exhausted, and no catalysts are forthcoming. The risk of a total loss far outweighs any speculative upside.

panic_analysis.opportunity_reason: 📊 Moderate fear detected - monitor for escalation

fear_vs_facts.verdict: ⚖️ Mixed signals - Fear and facts balanced, wait for clarity

catalyst_pipeline.title: Watch for: Funding announcement or operational update

decision_matrix.reason: ⏳ Monitor for timing regime change or panic escalation

volume_death.description: High volume - Panic spike or interest

technical_score.reason: AI Technical Score 12.0/20 translates to 15/25 points

reasons_to_buy.reason: Early stage positioning offers best R:R if catalysts appear
Proven winner - previously hit lock-in target

trader_plan.action: Wait for base + catalyst confirmation; starter position only
trader_plan.risk: Invalidation = breaks recent lows / dilution / suspension
trader_plan.profit_taking: Scale out 25% at +15%, 25% at +50%, runner above

investor_plan.thesis_conditions: Unlock after AI triangulation + CONFIRMED timing

commentary.executive_summary: Note: this report used historical signals only — live triangulation (RNS, social, Trends) was not available. Current setup looks like EARLY_BUILD with an APEX score of 44/100. Historically there have been 0 rallies (avg. 7%); the position is now +6.6%. Practical take: this is interesting but unconfirmed — wait for an AI snapshot or clear confirmation before committing size.
bull_case: Early accumulation — good risk/reward if it confirms
bear_case: No immediate red flags, but keep stops tight
commentary.timing_translation: Accumulation in progress. Consider small starters but wait for confirmation before sizing up.
commentary.confidence_explained: Confidence 55/100 — data triangulated from RNS, social and Trends.
